result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Anthony Kaczmarek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

PROBATION REVIEW HEARING 12/18/2105 at 1:30 p.m. in BR. 36.

miscConds.notes: EACH COUNT:  Pay DV surcharge  plus all other costs and surcharges. Civil judgment if not paid.

No contact with victim unless approved by the Court.
No contact with firearms.

Complete Batterers Intervention Program.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Pay supervisoin fees.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: conditions as listed on count one.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Anthony Kaczmarek

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI.

Defendant Matthew Anthony Kaczmarek in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Court has not received a report.  DOC to contact the agent in Antigo and get a report to the court.  If it is good, the court will not schedule another review.
The victim is in court and requesting a no violent contact order.  The court will leave it up to the agent.

The Conditions of Probation sheet that was completed indicated that the judge intended to have a review hearing.
Case adjourned for a probation review hearing on 12/18/2015 at 01:30 p.m.
cab
Memorandum of Conditions of probation states probation review hearing December 18, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.

Defendant Matthew Anthony Kaczmarek in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are in court for sentencing.
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. Additional statement by Mia N.
As to counts 1 and 2:
 Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction as to count 1 and 3 months in the House of Correction as to count 2, consecutive, with credit for 45 days served.  Court STAYED both sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 20 months, concurrent,  with the following conditions:
- Serve 60 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Jury trial is vacated.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-08-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew Anthony Kaczmarek in court with Attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Matthew Anthony Kaczmarek in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On motion of the State, Court orders repeater penalty enhancer stricken from both counts.

 As to Count 1 and Count 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY to the amended counts.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Matthew Anthony Kaczmarek not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has an offer. Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with MIA N.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Matthew Anthony Kaczmarek in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Matthew Anthony Kaczmarek in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
